name: Dance Party First
desc: Welcome to GakkoBlocks! Drag blocks from the middle columnn into Cat's controller, then hit Play to make Cat move.
hint: Put 3 Jumps inside the Cat's controller.
instructions: Make Cat jump 3 times!

name: Whack-a-mole
hint: For Testing
instructions: For Testing

name: Let's Jump!
hint: Put one Jump inside Cat Event block.
instructions:
Let's get started with GakkoBlocks! Can you make Cat do a jump?

Drag a Jump from the Toolbox to the Cat Event block, then click Play.

name: Dance Party
hint:
Put 3 Jumps inside the Cat Event block.
Remember to click Play!
instructions:
Let's make Cat jump 3 times.

Make Cat jump multiple times by dragging more Jumps to the Cat Event block.

name: Rabbits Jump Higher
hint:
Drag the new Jump into the Rabbit Event block.
Have you tried changing the number in Jump by typing a new number?
instructions:
We have a new sprite Rabbit, and a new kind of Jump!

Make Rabbit jump 200cm.

name: When Cat Meets Rabbit
hint:
Remember that the Jump block lets the animal jump to whatever height you type into the number box.
Make Rabbit jump 100 x 2 = 200cm.
instructions:
Rabbit jumps higher than Cat!

Make Cat jump 100cm, and make Rabbit jump 2x that amount!

name: Jump in Sequence
hint:
Cat should jump first, so add a Jump to Cat Event block.
Meanwhile, Rabbit should wait for Cat to jump before jumping, so add a Wait, then a Jump, to Rabbit Event block.
Try repeating this pattern to get Cat and Rabbit to jump one after another.
instructions:
Let's try something harder. Cat and Rabbit would like to jump one after another. Make them jump in this order: Cat will jump first, then Rabbit jumps. Cat jumps again, then Rabbit jumps again.
Use the new Wait block to tell the Cat or Rabbit to wait.
They only need to wait for 2 seconds each time.

name: Going Forward
hint:
Stuck? Don't forget what we've learned in the 1st chapter!
Drag the Forward block to the Cat Event block. Type in a number to tell Cat how far to move forward.
instructions:
Now that we've got Jumps down, let's make Cat move around! We have a new block called Forward for that.

For starters, make Cat move forward 150cm.

name: Drive Cat Up the Wall
hint:
Use Rotate to turn Cat 90 degrees. Click on the number box to select a number.
Don't forget Cat needs to move 150cm up the wall!
instructions:
Let's do something more interesting. Make Cat go 150cm up the wall.

How does it go up?

name: Cat Running Up the Wall
hint: Cat is 200cm away from the wall. Tell it to go forward first before going up the wall.
instructions:
That was fun! Let's make Cat go 300cm up the wall this time!

Hmm, but this time Cat seems to be further from the wall...

name: Drawing Time!
hint: Is Cat not drawing properly? You need to tell Cat to put its Pen Down before moving forward.
instructions:
Let us show you a new block, the Pen block! If you add a Pen Down block to Cat, it means we are asking Cat to leave a line when moving.

Let's use it to draw a 200cm straight line. Use both Pen and Forward to draw!

name: Drawing a Right Angle
hint:
Each straight line that Cat draws only needs to be 150cm.
Did you tell Cat to put its Pen Down? Before Cat starts moving?
instructions:
Great job so far!

Next, program Cat to draw a right angle. That's 90 degrees!

name: Acute Cat
hint:
Each straight line that Cat draws only needs to be 150cm.
Remember to Rotate Cat properly so it can draw the line at 45 degrees!
Recall that a straight line's angle is 180 degrees. That means Cat needs to turn 180 - 45 degrees.
instructions:
Hmm, so far we have only used right angles. Let's go for acute angles next!

Get Cat to draw a 45 degrees angle.

name: As Equals
hint:
Need some help? Remember to set Pen Down before moving Forward in both Event blocks.
Cat and Rabbit only need to move 200cm.
instructions:
Enough angles for now, let's see if you can get Cat to draw something together with Rabbit.

Draw an equal sign!
But this time, let's draw thicker lines with Set Pen Size, can you figure out how to use it?
Draw 200cm lines with any thickness you'd like!.

name: It's a Plus!
hint:
Rabbit needs to Rotate first before moving Forward.

Remember to put all Pen blocks on top of the Movement blocks inside Event blocks. This is so that Cat and Rabbit know what to do with Pen before drawing.
instructions:
Cat and Rabbit both want to draw together again!

Draw a plus sign next!
Each line should be 15cm thick, and 350cm long.

name: X
hint:
Rabbit should Rotate 45 degrees.
Cat should Rotate 360 - 45 degrees to match Rabbit's rotation.
Make sure your Pen blocks are all above Movement blocks.
instructions:
We will kick it up a notch and draw a large X now.

Let each line be 15cm thick and 400cm long. Be sure to Rotate each animal properly!

name: Colours and Hexagons
hint:
A hexagon's internal angle is always 120 degrees, so Rabbit needs to Rotate by 180 - 120 = 60 degrees.
Ladybug should Rotate by 60 + 60 = 120 degrees.
Octopus should Rotate by 120 + 60 = 180 degrees.
Cat does not need to Rotate before drawing.

See if you can figure out the rotations for Lion and Monkey!
instructions:
Great job so far! For the last challenge, draw a hexagon with 6 animals!

Each animal should draw a coloured line that matches their colour. And each line should be exactly 150cm long.

Notice there's a new block Set Pen Colour! Click on the colour box to choose a new colour for the pen to draw.
You can use the preset Set Pen Colour blocks on the right if you get stuck.

name: When Cat Meets Lion
hint:
Have you tried entering a negative number into Forward?
Move Cat backwards 200cm.
instructions:
Let's start with a recap of Forward, click Play and you will see Cat moving forward. Hey! There's Lion coming out of nowhere!

Help Cat move backwards away from Lion!

name: Monkey's Moonwalk
hint:
Monkey should move backwards 100cm, then wait 0.1 seconds.
Repeat the pattern 4 times.
instructions:
This is Monkey! He likes dancing, so let's help him do a moonwalk.

Use Forward and Wait in sequence to recreate the steps shown in the GIF on the right.

Tip: Right-click a block in the workspace (outside of toolbox) and select Duplicate to make an exact copy of the block.

name: Be Square
hint:
To help you get started, tell Cat to put Pen Down, go Forward 200cm, then Rotate by 90 degrees.
Figure out the rest of the steps from there!
instructions:
Cat is back to draw more things! This time, Cat wants to draw shapes. So we will program Cat to draw a square!

Let Cat draw a 200cm by 200cm square.

name: Float Like a Butterfly
hint: Drag Rotate to Butterfly Event block. Enter 360 into the number box.
instructions:
Meet Butterfly! Butterflies fly around, so let's program Butterfly to do a simple 360 degrees rotation.

Rotate block is slightly different this time round, click on the number box to enter a number.

name: Monkey the Ninja
hint:
Monkey runs Forward 200cm each time.
Do a roll by using Rotate by 360 degrees.
instructions:
Let's use Rotate again! Monkey is here to do a ninja roll, so let's get to it!

Get Monkey to run forward 200cm, do a roll, and run forward again.

name: Monkey the Ninja Part II
hint:
Monkey runs Forward 200cm each time.
Do a roll by using Rotate by 360 degrees.
Use a negative number to Rotate to the right.
instructions:
Hmm wait a minute, ninjas roll forwards when running. Let's get Monkey to roll to the right instead.

Can you figure out how to use Rotate to roll Monkey the other way?

name: Dash Dash Dash
hint:
The checkbox in Pen Down/Up lets Cat know whether to put Pen Down or not. A Pen Down/Up with its checkbox unchecked tells Cat to lift Pen Up and does not leave a line when moving.

For the first dash, drag into Cat Event the following:
Pen Down with tick, Forward 100cm, Pen Down without tick, Forward 100cm.
Figure the rest out yourself!
instructions:
We have a new Pen Down/Up block for you to use with Cat. Draw a dashed line, each dash should be 100cm long.

Can you figure out how to use the new Pen Down/Up block?
Use Hint if you get stuck!

name: Equality
hint:
Set Pen Size only needs to be done once before Cat starts drawing. There is no need to Set Pen Size every time Pen Down/Up is used!

To help you get started, use the following block sequence:
Set Pen Size to 15cm, Pen Down, Forward 200cm, Rotate 90 degrees, Pen Up, Forward 100cm.
Complete the rest of the sequence on your own!
instructions:
Now that we have Pen Down/Up, let's get Cat to draw an equal sign on its own!

Each line Cat draws should be 200cm long, and the lines should be 100cm apart.
Be sure to tell Cat to Set Pen Size to 15cm before drawing!

Tip: Try to work out the Movements of Cat first before adding Pen Down/Up blocks to the sequence.

name: Stay Positive
hint:
To help you get started, use the following block sequence:
Pen Down, Rotate 90 degrees, Forward 400cm, Pen Up.
Complete the rest of the sequence on your own!
instructions:
You have passed the equal sign challenge, but can you defeat this?

Program Cat to draw a plus sign!

name: Hashtag, You Are It!
hint:
You only need to use Rotate by 90 degrees.

Here's the first part of the sequence to help you out:
Pen Down, Rotate 90 degrees, Forward 300cm, Pen Up, Rotate 90 degrees, Forward 100cm, Rotate 90 degrees, Pen Down, Forward 300cm.
instructions:
Great work! Now let's see if you can get Cat to draw a hashtag!
The lines in the hashtag should each be exactly 300cm long.

name: Wish Upon a Star
hint:
Hard puzzle? Use angles to help you, each point of a star has an angle of 36 degrees.

To start, Cat needs to Rotate by 36 degrees.
Then Rabbit needs to Rotate by 36 + 72 = 108 degrees.
Ladybug will need to Rotate by 108 + 72 = 180 degrees.

See a pattern? Use it to program the rest of the animals!
instructions:
We have reached the last challenge of this chapter! Draw a star with 5 animals.

Each animal should Rotate to a different angle, and draw a coloured line that matches their colour.
Each line should be exactly 300cm long.

You can use the preset Set Pen Colour blocks on the right if you get stuck.

name: Return of the Dance Party
hint:
Drag a Loop to Cat Event block, then drag a Jump inside the Loop.

Type 3 in the Loop's number box.
instructions: Let's get cracking! Program Cat to jump 3 times, but this time, use a Loop block!

name: Let's Be Ninjas
hint:
Remember, use a Loop in each Event to repeat certain actions.

A forward roll would need a Rotate by -360 degrees.

Using a Loop means you can put Movements for 1 ninja roll in the Loop and repeat it as many times as you want.
instructions:
Monkey is here to teach Cat to ninja roll!

1 ninja roll means to run forwards 100cm and then do a forward roll.
Get Monkey and Cat to do 3 ninja rolls together!

name: Loopy Square
hint:
Did you set pen colour and pen size in Pen block?

The colour red needed is in row 2, column 4.

Besides a Pen block, you only need 1 Loop, 1 Forward and 1 Rotate.
instructions:
Loops are useful everywhere! Can you use a Loop to draw a square with Cat?

Draw a 300cm by 300cm square.

Notice we have given you a new Pen block to Pen Down/Up, Set Pen Colour and Set Pen Size at the same time! Use it well!

name: Triangle
hint:
Use the colour yellow at row 5, column 4.

This is an equilateral triangle, which means all its sides are equal. All its internal angles are equal too, at 60 degrees.
So Cat should Rotate the supplementary angle of 60 degrees, which is 180 - 60 degrees.

Blocks needed:
1 Pen, 1 Loop, 1 Forward and 1 Rotate.
instructions:
Good job! Let's work on more shapes next. Get Cat to draw a triangle this time!

Each side of the triangle should be 300cm long.

name: Hexagon Returns
hint:
Set pen colour to row 9, column 4.

Use supplementary angles to help you choose what angle to Rotate to.
instructions:
Next, we will draw another hexagon, using a Loop this time!

Use a purple line of size 10cm, and make each side of the hexagon 200cm long.

name: Plus a Loop
hint:
Use the colour green in row 6, column 7.

The plus sign can be broken down into 4 shorter lines of length 200cm, which are each at 90 degrees rotation apart from each other.

The blocks needed are:
1 Pen, 1 Loop, 2 Forward and 1 Rotate.
instructions:
How about something harder? Let's see if we can draw a plus sign with Loop as well. See if you can design a repeatable pattern to draw it!

The plus sign should be in green and each line should be 400cm long and 10cm thick.

name: Going Parallel
hint:
Recall that Rotate with a negative number turns Cat to the other direction.

The colour needed is located in row 7, column 7.

Here's the final sequence to help you out:
Loop
Inside Loop: Rotate, Pen Down, Forward, Forward, Rotate, Pen Up, Forward.
Fill in the required values yourself!
instructions:
This next challenge is a little harder, be careful when planning your blocks!
Draw 3 vertical lines, each 300cm long, 20cm thick, and a dark teal colour. They are also 100cm apart from each other.

Tip: Pen Up does not require you to set pen colour or size, just using the block with checkbox unchecked will do.

name: Going Up the Stairs
hint:
Each 'step' is 100cm long.

Loop should contain instructions to draw 2 lines.
instructions:
Great work! Now let's make a staircase! Work out a pattern that can be reused in a Loop!

Tip: Loop should repeat 4 times.

name: The Pentagon
hint:
Use the dark blue in row 8, column 7.

Each side of the pentagon is 10cm thick and 200cm long.

The internal angle of a pentagon is 108 degrees, so we should Rotate Cat to the supplementary angle of?
instructions: Let's recap shapes before entering the final challenge. Can you draw a pentagon with Cat?

name: Catch a Falling Star
hint:
The star is made up of 300cm lines of size 10cm.

Set the pen colour to row 5, column 4.

Recall that stars have internal angles of 36 degrees in each of its 'point'. Apply your knowledge of supplementary angles to this!
instructions: Whew! Now that it's the final challenge, let's draw a bright yellow falling star!

name: Click to Jump
hint: Place a Jump inside Click Event block. Click Play. Click on Rabbit as many times as you want to see what happens.
instructions:
Let's get started on learning Events! We'll start simple first, and go with programming Rabbit to jump once when Rabbit is clicked on.

Drag a Click Event to the workspace, then place a Jump inside it.

name: Much Random
hint:
Notice there is a new block called Random Number!
Drag it into Jump's number box. They will fit together like puzzle pieces!

After clicking Play, you can click Rabbit as many times as you like to see Rabbit jumping to different heights.
instructions:
Let's practice using Click Event again!

This time Rabbit wants to jump to a random height from between 100cm and 500cm every time it is clicked on.

name: Butter-Fly
hint:
Remember Random Number can fit into number boxes!

Put Random Number into both Rotate and Move.

Lower and Upper Bounds for Random Numbers:
Rotate: 90 to 360 degrees
Move: -100 to 100cm for both X and Y coordinates
instructions:
Now we will do a simple program to get Butterfly to fly around when clicked on! Try to guess how it might be done!

Every time Butterfly is clicked, we get Butterfly to do a random Rotate, then Move by a random distance to another part of the screen.

Tip: If Butterfly flies off the screen while playing with it, restart Play Mode to get it to return to its original position.

name: Ups-a-Daisy
hint: Drag 1 Keyboard Event to the workspace, and put a Jump inside. Click Play.
instructions:
Another useful event block is the Keyboard Event!
We'll use it now to get Cat to jump every time you press Up on your keyboard!

name: Cat the Ninja
hint:
If you have forgotten, 1 ninja roll is equivalent to running forwards 100cm, then doing a forward roll.

Is Rotate set to a negative number?

Did you set Keyboard Event to the correct key?
instructions: Cat is good at doing ninja rolls now, so lets get Cat to do a ninja roll every time you press the Right arrow on your keyboard!

name: Ultimate Ninja
hint:
Look closely at the toolbox, there's a new block there that you can use.

Use the new block before adding the Movements.
instructions:
Hmm Cat is pretty good at ninja rolls, but Monkey can do them faster!

Get Monkey to do ninja rolls when right key is pressed. But how do we make Monkey go faster than Cat?

name: Run, Run, Run
hint: Use Set Speed to set speeds for Cat, Snail and Monkey respectively.
instructions:
Cat and friends Monkey and Snail have to do some running for Physical Education class. Let's get them to run together when you press right!

Every time right key is pressed, Cat, Snail and Monkey should run forwards 50cm.

name: Cat On a Roll
hint:
You will need 2 Keyboard Event blocks, 1 to set actions for the right key, and 1 to set actions for the left key.

When left key is pressed, Cat should Rotate to the left by 5 degrees, then Change X by -5cm.
When right key is pressed, Cat should Rotate to the right by 5 degrees, then Change X by 5cm.
instructions:
Cat is feeling lazy today (after all that running in Physical Education) and just wants to roll around...
Program Cat to roll to the left when left key is pressed, and to roll to the right when right key is pressed.

name: Paint with All the Colours
hint:
You will need 4 Keyboard Event blocks. Each block should contain only 1 Pen, and either a Change X or a Change Y.

The Size setting for Pen has already been set for you. Same for the values in Change X and Change Y, you only need to decide whether to use 3cm or -3cm
instructions:
Looks like you are getting the hang of Keyboard Events! Let's use all four keys together!

Get Cat to draw with different colours when you move up or right!

name: Let's Collide!
hint:
Use Collision Event to determine what happens when Cat and Lion run into each other. When Cat collides with Lion, what should Cat do?

Cat should move back to its original position after moving forwards 300cm!
instructions:
Let's learn how to use Collision Event now!

First, click Play to see what happens. Lion will come out and collides with Cat! So let's program Cat to move backwards to its original position when it collides with Lion.

name: A Relay Race
hint:
First, put a Forward in Cat Event.

There's no Event blocks for Monkey or Snail, but we have Collision Event!

Consider:
What should Monkey do when Cat collides with it?
What should Snail do when Monkey collides with it?
instructions:
It's Physical Education class again! This time Cat, Monkey and Snail have to run a relay race!

Cat will run first, then Monkey, and finally Snail will run to complete the race. Each of them have to run 150cm to pass the baton to their friend.

name: Relay Race to the Lucky Crab!
hint:
The animals are arranged in a 300cm by 300cm square.

There should be:
1 Keyboard Event for Cat to Change X by 5cm.
1 Collision Event for Monkey to Move Y.
1 Collision Event for Snail to Move X and another Collision Event for when Snail hits Lucky Crab to increase Score by 10 points.

Remember to hold down right key after clicking Play to get Cat to run to Monkey!
instructions:
Here's a different form of a relay race! See if you can program it!

Here are the rules of the game:
You play as Cat, who should run forwards 5cm each time you press right key.
Once Cat reaches Monkey, Monkey should run downwards to Snail, who will run to the Lucky Crab.
Once Snail hits the Crab, our Score should keep increasing by 10 points until Lucky Crab disappears.

Tip: Lucky Crab disappears in 5 seconds each time you click Play!

name: Frogger
hint:
Cat is originally located at position (300, 100). Use Set Position to reset Cat to original location.

All the Events you will need are already laid out for you at the start.

Each Keyboard Event should only move Cat 5cm.

Both Butterfly Event and Bee Event should each contain 1 Loop Forever, 1 Forward, and 1 Rotate.
Each Collision Event should contain 1 Change Score and 1 Set Position.
instructions:
For the final round, let's make a simple version of the game Frogger! Refer to the GIF on the right and to the game rules below for help.

Rules:
1. Bee should move in a 200cm by 200cm square repeatedly.
2. Butterfly should repeatedly move across 400cm horizontally.
3. Each time Cat runs into Bee or Butterfly, Cat should return to its original position and 10 points should be deducted from Score.
4. Each time Cat runs into Lucky Crab, 50 points is added to Score, and Cat returns to its original position.

name: Video 1
hint: hint
instructions: instr

name: Video 2
hint: hint
instructions: instr
